channel.title: Favorite, most unique game soundtracks?
channel.description:
As the title suggests, what are your favorite soundtracks that also sound very distinguishable from other OSTs?
Here are some of my favorites:
HL/HL2 Diablo Daggerfall Unreal Hexen Quake 1 (though not totally)
[COLOR='Gray'] (I would have put Morrowind on here, but I also feel that it reminds me heavily of movie OSTs, so It looses some of it's uniqueness - it's still totally great tho)
I think HL definitely has an OST that stands out, because the sounds they use for their tracks sound like sounds that are from HL to me
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tmHW9hS2KZU[/url] [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bHuFKWBf-k0&feature=related[/url] [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8Yapk7PTNDw[/url]
DF as well, despite being midi, I think the music captures the feel of many of the climate types and Times of day: [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4A5yjeIgijw[/url] The redone ones still seem to sound unique too, despite not being MIDI [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b89Qa8qPmT0&feature=related[/url] [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hEUSMqL1mMw&feature=related[/url]
Of course Unreal is definitely one that is memorable, as again it is extremely atmospheric in it's music: [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-6pq393A2iE[/url] [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6YWfb3ti4V8&feature=related[/url] [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=burzlYxbUmI&feature=related[/url] [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SCbUxrZiUKk[/url]
Diablo, we all know the bone chilling sound of that OST that very few are able to mimic (if at all) [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=12Q-r7zV4EM[/url] [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q0KSoDKE26o&feature=related[/url]
I obviously missed some on my list, but what about you guys, what OST do you listen to that you can tell and just know it sounds different then anything else?

item.title: Favorite, most unique game soundtracks?
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
calhoun freeman:

He kinda didn’t show his full potential on Quake, but I LOVE his music and his talents.

<3 Trent Reznor.

What do you mean didn’t show his full potential? He did exactly what he needed to do, which was to make ambient tracks and enhance the mood. It worked. The world of quake still feels more foreboding and barren than any current game that tries to do that, and it’s his music that lets it happen.

Halo: the whole series, ODST being on top music wise.

Spyro the Dragon 1

Sly cooper: the whole damn series

The first shitty Bionicle game actually had a great OST.

Read full topic

item.description:

and GTA: SLC: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7EcEcXPQZM4

those and every other soundtrack from Half-Life

I was raised to Rockstar and VALVe. I hope they never stop farting out masterpieces.

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite, most unique game soundtracks?
item.dc:creator: sudpuzzer
item.description:
Personally, I am quite partial to the Terrans’ theme music on both Starcraft games. I love the way they manage to depict a bluesy western-space theme. For the most part, I like Starcraft 1’s terran music better than SC2’s, although when I heard the Starcraft 2 theme for the first time, it took me right back to the first game but then promptly jacked up the epicness.
Starcraft 1 Main theme
Starcraft 2 Main theme

However, my total favorite song from the games is definitely this one: Sara System Blues
I think this one perfectly captures the western-bluesy atmosphere and gives a sense of desolation, then cautious hope, and then springs into action to get the player going in the level.

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite, most unique game soundtracks?
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Don’t we have enough…Can we just stop making soundtrack threads?

sigh

MG2 - Zanzibar Breeze (and remixes)
MG2 - Theme of Solid Snake
MG2 - Tears
MG2 - The Front Line
MG2 - An Advance
MG2 - Under the Cloud of Darkness
MG2 - Frequency 140.85

MGS - Rex Lair
MGS - Cavern

MGS2 - Main Theme
MGS2 - Opening Infiltration
MGS2 - Tanker Incident
MGS2 - Infiltration (Jazzo Jazzo Electroooo)
MGS2 - Metal Gear is already active
MGS2 - Arsenal’s Guts (that bass… duh-duh duh-duh-duuuhh)
MGS2 - Arsenal Is Going To Take Off

MGS3 - Main Theme
MGS3 - CQC
MGS3 - Virtuous Mission
MGS3 - Shagohod
MGS3 - Mission Briefing (Conspiracy theorists, rejoice!)
MGS3 - Across The Border ~ Snake Meets The Boss
MGS3 - The Pain
MGS3 - Life’s End
MGS3 - The Sorrow ~ Everlasting Fight
MGS3 - Debriefing
MGS3 - Old Metal Gear (Starry.K)
MGS3 - Pillow Talk (Starry.K)

MGS4 - Next-Gen Control
MGS4 - Violent Ceasefire
MGS4 - Next Gen Control
MGS4 - Sin
MGS4 - Atonement
MGS4 - Infinite Loop
MGS4 - Everything Ends
MGS4 - At Dawn
MGS4 - Full Circle
MGS4 - Metal Gear Saga
MGS4 - Father & Son
MGS4 - Midnight Shadow
MGS4 - Surrounded (dun, dun… DUN DUN)

Snatcher - One night in Neo Kobe city
Snatcher - Bio Hazard

Streets of Rage soundtrack

Streets of Rage 2 - Dreamer
Streets of Rage 2 - Never Return Alive
Streets of Rage 2 - Back to the Industry
Streets of Rage 2 - Walking Bottom

G-loc soundtrack

Revenge of Shinobi soundtrack

JP : The Lost World soundtrack

JP: Rampage Edition soundtrack

Super Hang-on soundtrack

Matt Uelmen and his drums… will haunt me till I go to hell.

Red Alert 2 soundtrack - industrial at it’s finest.

All DMC soundtracks (especially 1 and 2) except 4.

Mechwarrior 2 soundtrack
Mechwarrior 4 Veng soundtrack
Mechwarrior 4 Merc soundtrack

The Darkness - Jenny’s Theme
The Darkness - The Darkness Suite
The Darkness - Credits/Ending

Trent Reznor

Does the opposite of fucking suck.

How in the world do those not sound like every Tony Scott movie ever?

Fuck off, Top Gun was different.

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite, most unique game soundtracks?
item.dc:creator: Flubly
item.description:
Bloodshot:

Holy shit, I love you for linking to my favorite song in that game that I nearly forgot about all these years.

Also, I’d like to add CoD 4’s soundtrack, as the composer they got made some music that doesn’t really sound like other movie’s games, and distinctly makes me think CoD 4.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uamh1l_tmeI
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0jtLsXYdvbU
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wnFKvFPyi3E&feature=related

Not so much the later cods tho.

How in the world do those not sound like every Tony Scott movie ever?

https://youtu.be/iRXyF9OeH2Q

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite, most unique game soundtracks?
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
Fuskox:

You mention MGS but don’t mention:

MGS2: Sons of Liberty Theme

or

MGS4: Old Snake

WTF?!

Wasn’t too much of a fan of 2’s music except for them main theme, though i like more of 4’s

And technically, that’s MGS1’s theme too:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9HMoMRAPico

I mentioned MGS1 because of how different the OST sounds from many other things, and this is similar about 4’s to an extent, though not of all songs from 4.

Read full topic

Oh god the mission failed track. I hated failing VR missions, but this song made it bearable

Theese are the most popular ones, enjoy.
